name: ray.data.read_api.read_datasource
signature: ray.data.read_api.read_datasource(datasource: ray.data.datasource.datasource.Datasource, *, parallelism: int = -1, ray_remote_args: Dict[str, Any] = None, concurrency: Optional[int] = None, override_num_blocks: Optional[int] = None, **read_args) -> ray.data.dataset.Dataset
summary: Read a stream from a custom :class:`~ray.data.Datasource`.

args.name: parallelism
args.desc: This argument is deprecated. Use ``override_num_blocks`` argument.

args.name: ray_remote_args
args.desc: kwargs passed to :meth:`ray.remote` in the read tasks.

args.name: concurrency
args.desc:
The maximum number of Ray tasks to run concurrently. Set this
to control number of tasks to run concurrently. This doesn't change the
total number of tasks run or the total number of output blocks. By default,
concurrency is dynamically decided based on the available resources.

args.name: override_num_blocks
args.desc:
Override the number of output blocks from all read tasks.
By default, the number of output blocks is dynamically decided based on
input data size and available resources. You shouldn't manually set this
value in most cases.

args.name: read_args
args.desc:
Additional kwargs to pass to the :class:`~ray.data.Datasource`
implementation.
